message_1:
Let X be the set of all real numbers. Define a function f: X -> X as follows: 

f(x) = x^3 - 3x^2 - x + 3 

Evaluate the function f(2) using higher-order logic.
message_2:
To evaluate the function f(2), we will substitute x with 2 in the given function:

f(x) = x^3 - 3x^2 - x + 3

f(2) = (2)^3 - 3(2)^2 - (2) + 3

Now, we will perform the operations:

f(2) = 8 - 3(4) - 2 + 3
f(2) = 8 - 12 - 2 + 3

Finally, we will simplify the expression:

f(2) = -4 - 2 + 3
f(2) = -6 + 3
f(2) = -3

So, f(2) = -3.
